amendment.description: To provide an additional $5 million to the military departments' respective Boards for Correction of Military Records to expedite review of cases in which service members with combat-related psychological injuries (such as PTSD) or closed head injuries (such as TBIs) were administered discharges for personality disorders or other discharges resulting in a loss of benefits or care and seek a correction of records or upgraded discharge.

vote.text: Amendment SA 4330 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Amendment SA 4330 proposed by Senator Conrad for Senator Obama. (consideration: CR S2078-2080; text: CR S2078) To provide an additional $5 million to the military departments' respective Boards for Correction of Military Records to expedite review of cases in which service members with combat-related psychological injuries (such as PTSD) or closed head injuries (such as TBIs) were administered discharges for personality disorders or other discharges resulting in a loss of benefits or care and seek a correction of records or upgraded discharge.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 4330 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
